Vocabularies.Definition: n. a person who applies for sth., esp. a post 求职者，申请人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Graduate schools generally require applicants to submit scores on the Graduate Record Exam (GRE).

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. question to decide if sb. is right for a job 面试
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  John is being interviewed next week for the Chief Executive's job.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a business that supplies goods or services to a purchaser 供应厂商；供应者
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Baosteel is the biggest supplier of steel sheets to Shanghai's auto industry.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  (infml) question intensely; cook under or over direct heat 盘问；烧烤
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Tom was grilled by customs officers for several hours.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  an article cut from a newspaper or magazine 剪报 clip vt.    cut (a piece) from sth. larger or whole 剪下
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The old man has been collecting newspaper clippings for years.

Vocabularies.Definition: take additional steps to further (a previous action) 采取进一步行动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  If you make a hotel booking by phone, follow it up with written confirmation.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a positive feeling of wanting to push ahead with sth. 渴望；热切
in sb.'s possession 在某人手中，为某人所拥有
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His father's company has been in his hands for some years.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  亲手送交
a.  likely to become or be 可能成为的；预期的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The chief function of direct-mail advertising is to familiarize prospective buyers with a product.

Vocabularies.Definition: in my opinion 在我看来
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  As I see it, this press conference is the most successful one we have ever had.

Vocabularies.Definition: 俗话说，常言道 e.g.  As an old English saying goes, "If you want to live and thrive, let a spider run alive!"
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  as good as the best in the world 世界级的
n. 运动员 e.g.  The athlete has a powerful physique.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. an effort or attempt to do sth.  努力，尽力 v. try (to do sth.) 努力（做某事），尽力（做某事） e.g.  Please make every endeavor to arrive punctually.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  only likely to happen once in sb.'s life 一生中仅有一次的
n.    an occupation, esp. regular paid work 职业，就业 e.g.  The automobile industry continues to be an important source of employment in that country.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: make preparations beforehand 事先做好准备 e.g.  Before you go near a stockbroker, do your homework.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: try hard to obtain 努力争取，追求 e.g.  Are you planning to go after Peter's job when he leaves?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    （篮球） 投篮得分
a.   not ready 未准备好的
a.     （体育） 反手的
ad.   by the way 顺便提起地，附带地 e.g.  Incidentally, this wine goes particularly well with cheese.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  one of a pair or team in a sport or game; person who takes part in an activity with another or others 搭档；同伙 e.g.  She is one of the five partners in the firm of lawyers.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  咯咯地笑
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The professor chuckled when we told her that we were afraid of her.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    类，档次；托架，撑架
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Women outnumbered men three to two in the over-65 age bracket.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. with regard to the body; according to the laws of nature 身体上地；按自然法则地 physical a.   of or concerning the body; of or concerning the laws of nature 身体的；按自然法则的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Physically I find him very attractive, but we don't have the same outlook on life.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  构造，结构
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Morphology is concerned with the structure of words, syntax with the structure of phrases and sentences.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  肺
n. an attempt or try; a sharp snapping sound 尝试；噼啪声 take/have a crack (at)    try to do (sth.) 尝试
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They have decided to have a crack at the doubles championship.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    肯尼亚人
n.   a time limit by which sth. must be done 最终期限
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Tomorrow is the deadline for the students to hand in their term paper.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   possible to be measured 可测量的
capable of being identified 可识别的，可确认的 identify  vt. 识别，鉴别
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  In her bright yellow coat, she was easily identifiable in the crowd.

Vocabularies.Definition: change the situation or outlook; have an effect 改变现状或观点； 产生影响
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Having a good teacher has made all the difference for Alex.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  thoroughly, absolutely 完全，彻底
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was downright rude to me.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  extremely or unpleasantly dirty 非常肮脏的，污秽的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The beggar was in filthy rags.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.    exhibit, display 展示，显示
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was heavily-built and sported a red moustache.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. impossible to penetrate 穿不透的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The mountain range was an almost impenetrable barrier between the two continents.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   impenetrable by bullets 防弹的
n.   分割物，隔离物
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Glass partitions divided the room into individual offices.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  in a polite manner 有礼貌地 courteous    a.   polite and respectful, well-mannered 有礼貌的，举止得体的
移动电话，手机
vt.  utter abruptly and thoughtlessly 未加思索地冲口说出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  As soon as the teacher put forward the question, he blurted the answer out.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  try to look into private facts about a person 窥探，探究
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We don't want people prying into our affairs.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a wise and trusted guide and advisor 良师益友，导师，顾问
about 大约
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He has an annual salary in the neighborhood of $40,000.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  in a generous manner 慷慨地，不吝啬地 generous  a.  giving or willing to give freely 大方的，慷慨的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The farmer generously allowed us to camp on his land.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    喷气式飞机
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Commercial air transport has experienced massive growth with the advent of jet airliners.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  joyously 快乐地，欢欣地
more than anyone /one can ever imagine 无论如何也想不到的，做梦也不敢想的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Ten years ago it was beyond my wildest dreams that I could afford a car.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  闪烁，闪耀
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The diamond ring sparkled in the sunlight.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    立场, 观点 from one's/the standpoint (of) from one's/the viewpoint (of) 从…的观点来看
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  From humans standpoint, all of the world's physical resources are in finite supply.
